alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington, northeastern Johnson and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 250 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Bartow, or 11 miles southwest of Louisville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Wadley, Davisboro, Bartow, Riddleville, Moxley, New Home, and Pringle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
